text: <@U01T801C4BU> You can specify a default language, for domains, as well for smart-content and global-content. The default act like a fallback. HubSpot tries to detect the language of the user, by the IP-address. But if the url contain a specific language parameter, it will go directly to the specified page in the parameter. And keep in mind, that once the page is indexed by search engines, the most users will directed to the correct language.

<@U01T801C4BU> If it is a known user, you can set a _preferred language_ for them. You can get that property for your contacts by setting the _preferred language_ field as an hidden one in your translated versions of your forms. Based on that property you can choose translated follow-ups or other kind of workflow based language processes.

And avoid Smart-Content for translation, it drops the page-speed and should not be the first-choice to translate a page.
